text: This is one of my favorite views in Chicago! Took there my girlfriends on Saturday night. It was easy to get in (we came before 9pm). It was not crowded, bartenders were pleasant and helpful with our drink orders. I had a margarita and it was not bad at all, a bit pricey thou. I like the fact that they have a DJ playing, also in case it rains you can sit inside. The view is great both night and day time.

Great views. Like Drake could be rapping about views from this rooftop. The afternoon was cool and breezy, had an IPA. They have seating indoors and kitscy decor. It rained briefly and there was ample space inside. Various times when I'm downtown and wanting a snack or drink before 5 and not wanting to go to a crowded beer and shot place. They only have 3 taps but have ample cocktail making ingredients. I like the uniforms the waitresses were donning black dresses and denim jackets. Classy yet casual blend.
Been waiting for a place like this in Chicago for a long time! Very classy yet casual rooftop and the perfect spot to celebrate with friends or meet interesting people from all over the country

This review is for the FOOD FYI. I was so hungry out with a friend for happy hour drinks which turned into a few different places. Around 8/8:30 we were at Cesire rooftop and starving. Their 'bites' menu is fairly limited; fair enough this is a bar.  I was trying to decide between chips and guacamole $10 or coconut shrimp toast $12. Server said shrimp toast is good and there are six. Perfect done.  It was NOT good. The toast was burnt to a crisp it was barely toast anymore. I didn't get a photo unfortunately but it was like two burned pieces of toast with a miniature amount of what I have to assume was coconut shrimp in between cut into six pieces; it was an incredibly disappointing amount and flavor for $15 ($12 plus tip and tax). I was expecting a small portion but at least something tasty???!  Now the views here absolutely amazing. The drinks and late night scene I can't speak to
LOVE the views from this rooftop and the staff is super friendly. My waitress Chrissy was absolutely amazing. Very sweet and talkative while providing excellent service.
Stunning roof top bar with an excellent DJ. A lovely Place to chill with a cold drink after a hard days shopping in this beautiful city.

Favorite roof top bar in the city! They have really stepped up their game this summer. While other rooftops in the area price gouge and have awful service, cerise actually delivers a great 360 experience. If the rooftop view isn't enough, go for the awesome bartenders and great decor. Definitely Instagram worthy and the cocktails light on fire!

Came to enjoy the roof top, but it closed rather early and we were all forced inside. Thre view though is nice and the area outside was great. bar itself also closes earlier than others. The seating is a nice touch in both bar areas, the dance floor layout if dead center though so your forced to one side of the other when the patio doors are shut.
Very nice little rooftop.  Went here for drinks on  a date night  with the husband and it was a nice atmosphere.

Located atop the Virgin Hotel, Cerise is the aesthetically pleasing rooftop bar. The views and decor are fantastic. Aside from that, my experience at Cerise was less than stellar. Having worked in Customer service, I let a lot slide because I get it.  Cerise seems to be the place people go to after work. And with it not being a large space it can be hard to find a seat. If you're going with a group, it would be best that someone get there early to grab seats if possible. The staff didn't seem to be happy during my visit except for the security guard. They've employed beautiful people, but looks don't make up for personality and kindness. It could have been an off day, but not for everyone working.  We found seats outside, and the server on the patio completely ignored us until the end. I just went to the bar and got drinks. Not a problem at all, the bartender seemed annoyed but kept it professional. Again, I've worked in customer service, so there are certain cues I've learned to be able to deal with situations. An hour later and after everyone started leaving the patio server finally comes over to our table. She had been on our side serving people many times never stop our table. I had a tab going, and I told her because I was going to order another drink. She goes in and comes back and says there's no tab for me then disappears again.  At that point, My friend and I are over it. I go in and check with the bartender I first saw, and yes the tab was there. She closed it, and we left. Not sure If I would go back although, I've been invited there next week.

Really cool atmosphere with amazing rootop views overlooking downtown. Drinks were about  $10+ for cocktails & $7+ for beers. I'd definitely return, I liked this place a lot. Perfect for a summer night out. No cover when we got there either, which was prob around 9pm-ish. Outside seating is very limited so you may have to wait a bit for a seat by the glass to have the good view.
This place is a joke. Was there recently for a day party on a Sat. The waitress scam you out of money and they keep charging my credit card.  Never again will I be back here.

Great drink menu, very small food menu, like the only thing I could order was guacamole. There was a group of us sitting outside and our server said she needed one card to open tab with. Then later she put the whole bill on that one card saying she couldn't split it! WTH?! I would go here during the day as it's super hot and no shade coverage.

Ehhhh, 3.5 if I could.  It's a pretty standard Loop rooftop, though the views are pretty awesome.  Drink prices weren't awful, considering the location, and the chips and guac we ordered were good.  Despite the chill we did sit in the outside part of the rooftop, and they had decent seating options. The issue comes more with the service-we started out with one server, who was okay but not great or really all that friendly.  After a while she came over and asked if we wanted to close our tab-we said no, because we weren't ready.  She then came back to explain she was leaving and someone else would be taking over, then came back a few minutes later with the new server, who was super friendly and attentive. When it came time to pay the bill, the (new) server brought out the receipt and it looked like the card had been charged, but the card wasn't in the folio.  When my friend asked our server she said she'd been told by the (previous) server when she left it was given back-nope.  Turns out the (new) server had to call the (previous) server three times to try and figure out where the card was-turns out it was sitting on top of their computer.  Everything turned out okay, but it was a big hassle that seemed to take way longer than it should have, and when you're dealing with people's credit cards being MIA that's a little disconcerting.  It was a decent experience except for that sour note at the end, though I did give credit since it turned out okay.

Great place for happy hour!  Perfect views of the city at sunset.  They need a few extra chairs for the outdoor area and should utilize the space a bit better.  Also, the couch chairs outside are way too long and too bulky and uncomfortable.

I've been here a few times, usually just for a quick drink with a view. Cerise has a great view of Marina City, Trump Tower and the Jeweler's Building. I've generally been able to grab a small table while there after work.  I went recently for an event held on the south part of the patio. I am usually a wine girl but they had two drinks on the menu and I was blown away! I was also really intersted to know that they were both on tap! The Devil in the Hot Seat, was a bourbon based drink which is not my thing, but it was AMAZING! Had a ton of flavor (none of it bourbon) and they set it on fire before they hand it off to you! We also tried the Watermelon Basil Daisy which was light and refreshing served with a slice of watermelon. These drinks are delicious and instagramable, definitely try one if you go!
I love everything about this bar. Except that my table was sloped and smooth and made my drink slide on to my lap. Still would come here often.

Would've been an okay review. The drinks were fine the bartenders pseudo friendly. But when we were ready to leave the elevators were out. We waited. No one seemed concerned. We waited some more. People that worked there seemed annoyed we were annoyed. We walked down 26 flights of stairs. All of us. And when we made some comments. No one cared.  Terrible customer service and apparently some elevator maintenance needed.

The views were very nice BUT the food not so good.  Ordered tacos &  Quesadillas and Although not the worst it was not the greatest...both items were luke warm at best.  Menu is very limited...including the 2 items I ordered there were 2 or 3 others.  Bottoms line eat before or after u visit. If u do want to try out definitely nice for just view, ambience, & drinks.  I was there before the crowd hit but when I was on my way out i saw a band coming in so they do have music. Parking for me was $18 for 3hrs on a sat.   Don't try calling they never answer the phone unless u call the hotel part for info.
This place has been one of my favorite places to go in Chicago. Service is always excellent and drinks are well made. Not to mention the awesome views.

I came here with some friends after seeing a show at the Chicago Theater.  Good notes:  The place is cute, and it wasn't super crowded. The bar food is tasty (minus the chicken tacos). Matcha Made in Heaven was the best drink I had that night. If I had to choose between this or the Wit, I'd choose Cerise 100% of the time.  Bad notes: The music was very hit or miss. They only had heaters on one side of the rooftop deck. I can't blame them that a loop hotel location draws in the suburban / tourist / older crowd. Prices per drink were a bit steep, but, again, that's most likely due to the crowd they draw.
Great after work drink spot!  They make their Manhattans strong.  PERFECTION!  If you don't get here by 6p or don't bother.  There won't be any space left.  Great views!

Anyone visiting Cerise rooftop @ Virgin Hotel on the 26th floor - make sure you see Courtney, Jessica, and Javier. They provide extraordinary customer service and made us feel at home and remained professional the entire evening. Most lit crew of chi town. #STAYWOKE #COURTNEY4OFFICE
Awesome view and extremely nice staff , our waitress was very knowledgeable about drinks and her recommendations were just on point. I'll definitely come back

Only had a couple of drinks here but the view is great. Drinks were great as well. Some of them a bit pricey but you should expect that being in the city and the views you are provided.  Will be back!

Quaint yet lively. Fast, polite and accommodating bartenders. Shannon the manager really went out of her way to make an impromptu birthday celebration and epic one. I would stay at the Virgin Hotel just to come to Cerise

I consistently have a great time when I visit Cerise, especially if I want to hear good music and  be surrounded by beautiful/funky decor. The mood is posh yet relaxed and the cocktails are delicious. I took my friend who was visiting from Virginia here and he got an opportunity to meet Chance The Rapper! Definitely my top 5 places to go in Chicago!

Ok so my hubby and I and another couple stayed at the Virgin Hotel for a date night.  We ended up coming to Cerise twice...once before going out and we ended the evening here till the wee hours of the morning.  Drinks are on point...some pricey, some reasonable... music was great when we went.  Not a lot of room for dancing, but I'll shake my groove thang anywhere so I really don't care.  I really would like to check it out in the summer to see how the outdoor area is.  We had a wonderful time and the staff was great as well.  I can't wait to come back again.

My only regret about this place is that we should have checked it out during the summer. It was quite cold the night we went, but I still went outside to soak in the awesome views of our beautiful city.  We went on a Tuesday night so it wasn't crowded at all, but be warned that this place gets packed on weekends. This is by far of the most chic and comfy rooftops bars I have been to. The décor is excellent, and the vibe is very chill on weekdays, and twerk-tastic on the the weekends.  If you have out of town guests, this is a must see destination if awesome rooftop bars are their thing. The drinks are a bit pricey, but it is what you have to pay for such a breathtaking view and excellent service. We will definitely be back once we thaw out from the impending Chiberia winter. This place is AWESOME!

This place WAS great - ive been a few times either Wednesdays or weekends, the DJs were always on point playing indie, hip hop, disco... "cool" edm. Halloween was hella fun too - a couple tag teams of girl and guy DJs, live MC, good drinks chill vibes good crowd. Something was off this weekend - the music/DJ were like cheesy Y bar downtown types and it was EMPTY. This would have been ok - it's that weird between holiday time, I get it - but the manager was hustling our waitress to push bottle service on us. Lady, we came here to get AWAY from that. And I thought Virgin was staying true to their brand with the earlier music and vibe. This was just cheesy. Long story short, I'll give it another shot. But if the bad DJs and shady manager lady are still there, we'll probably go elsewhere. Waitresses and bartenders and drinks are still good, and the view too, so one star each for those things. Haven't tried the food.

CHICAAAGO! Not sure what it was, but I really enjoyed my visit here the other night. My buddy ended up suggesting this rooftop bar as our rendezvous point to meet up with a college buddy we hadn't seen in years. What an excellent spot! For a Thursday night, not too crowded and easy service from the bar. Did I mention the views from the deck are top notch? You can easily see from south the Willis / Sears Tower all the way to the Trump building.  Cerise is situated on the 26th floor of the Virgin Hotel. Once you're up there, awesome ambiance & music accompanied with a swanky interior. Plenty of high top tables inside and lots of cabana like couches outside on the deck if you're looking to cozy up. Upon making our way to the bar, the bartender instantly greeted us with a smile and was ready and willing to serve. There's a number of signature cocktails, beer shandies, & wines they offer. However, no beers on draft & only a limited selection of bottled / canned options. For the most part, I think ambiance and staff friendliness went a long way to making this experience an enjoyable one.   If you're looking for a trendy bar / lounge to hit, definitely would recommend and for sure worth a stop for the Chicago skyline views.  'Til next time, cheers!

Hey, you wanna feel fancy? Why not try a top floor cocktail lounge? The view of the surrounding buildings makes you feel upper middle class and you can pretend to hear the glasses clink for cheers even though they're made of plastic.  Honestly, the interior is where it's at. The staff is pleasant and the layout is chic. They could do a little better with their electronic soundtrack though - less top 40 and more subtlety would make it feel like they're not trying to be a club. If you're set on going on the balcony, they do provide heaters and blankets, but they lack nice seating. This makes the place feel like more of a display than a real lounge I'd give this place a 4 star if they updated their soundtrack and got some real glasses. 5 if their balcony made the best of their view (which truly is a 4-star view.)

On the rooftop of the Virgin Hotel, with an birds eye view of the beautiful Chi Town skylines. Comfy patio loungers with over-sized, fluffy pillows adorn the outdoor area. There are heater lamps to keep you nice and toasty while you enjoy a drink. The decor is beautifully romantic and modern. Definitely trying to cater to the millennials.  The first night we were there, there was silent disco; everyone gets a headphone and listen to individual tracks of your choosing while jamming out in your own world. Mom dance moves allowed! The second night they were having a Halloween Costume party. We looked a little out of place as everyone else's idea of a costume is a masquerade mask. Very uppity and hoity-toity vibes going on.  Staff there are so nice and friendly, definitely a romantic spot with your sig other or a chill hangout place for you and your friends.

Really cool bar on the roof of Virgin hotel. I didn't know it existed and it felt somewhat hidden, even the way getting there. From the street signs outside, it is not really clear that there is a rooftop bar. Great cocktails and views on the city. A great spot to chill.
I came here last week with some coworkers for happy hour.  The views are great and the ambiance is pretty cool.  We just had drinks so I can't comment on the food but we had a great time!
Amazing Appetizers. Limited on Drinks available. Live Music. Roof top view. Good for a party night.
Service was no good. It was a slow Saturday night so should have been much more attentive.  While the rooftop and view was great that was it. It's all about service step it up.
Bland, overpriced, and cheesy. The rooftop has a great view, but the service is barely competent.

Went with friends Saturday around 3 p.m., able to go right up and sit on a few couches outside. Music was too loud for daytime but decent, server appeared at the right times. I tried a colada-something or other drink that should be stricken from the menu; the coconut syrup is overwhelmingly artificially sweet and makes the cocktail undrinkable. I sent it back for a mojito that was actually really good. Prices as expected for Loop Rooftops ($11-16+) Restrooms on a lower floor. Best view from where we were sitting is of Trump Tower, so I prefer other rooftops for drinks and scenery. Glad I checked it out, likely won't be back though.

Met up with some friends here on a recent trip to Chicago. The views are awesome! We were super impressed with our server, Chrissy, who was extremely attentive. I'll definitely be back on my next trip to Chicago!
This place could do better if the interior was better designed. Drinks are good....not excellent. Outside rooftop is very cosy and has a great view.

Okay, we visit here to have drinks on their 26th floor rooftop bar. Great vibe and incredible view of the city. The drink prices is a little expensive but, it's to be expected for downtown. They have s DJ on the weekend and the appetizer are oh, so good. The bar has plenty of outdoor seating and private couch inside for that intimate conversation. I recommend visiting if you staying near Trump hotel or other hotels nearby.

After being ignored by the bar tender who was looking at her phone instead of paying attention to her surroundings, I got charged $17 for a Moscow Mule that barely had any taste (and any vodka). The place is super cool and they play great music, but I think I'll be getting my drinks somewhere else.

Cool decor. Afternoon visit. Unfortunately there's no shade on the outdoor patio, and the indoor seating area on the rooftop has solid walls that block the view. We opted for the shade and no view. Cocktails were okay-- a little overpriced. Good service. The guac was very good-- homemade chips were good, but greasy.

awesome and fancy rooftop in downtown Chicago! the views are awesome and their drinks are good too. a little pricey, but overall the place is fun. I spent most of my 21st birthday here and then came again recently, the decor changes and this time it was like an African Safari or something - interesting!!!

I was here on  Saturday 07/23 for my birthday with family and friends.  It was raining that night so the rooftop was closed but we still had an amazing time.  The drinks were perfect and the DJ had the place lit!  We will definitely go again!

Great rooftop to hang out for drinks!!! Went there with two gal pals for birthday drinks. The service was absolutely great from start to finish. Always attentive and accommodating. The rooftop is chic looking an dhad plent of space for seating compared to other rooftops. The view is great and the music was perfect to get the night started. One thing me and my friends raved about were the small bites they had. We all picked something different and each one was delicious. The drinks were nice and strong and therefore worthy of the prices. Would so be coming back here.

Cerise is a beautiful rooftop in the city!  The ambiance is awesome! Unfortunately, we arrived at 9:30 PM on a Saturday night and there weren't any seats outside. :( So, we grabbed a seat closest to the outside. The views are lovely! The music was great! It started out w/ some good loungey house music and then turned into stuff you can dance to (old school hip hop, top 40).  Service was good...our server was friendly! There is a decent selection of drinks...but not too extensive.  I knocked off 2 stars for a couple of reasons. 1. I called 5 minutes before we got there to see if there was a line and a cover charge. I was informed that a cover is charged at 10:00 PM. We got there at 9:30...and were still charged a cover. Not cool.  2. We ordered some beer and it wasn't cold!!!! It was cool. Blah! Will I return...sure...as long as I don't have to pay a cover! :)

I have been to the rooftop multiple times previous to last night. The past few times were amazing!!! The past times service was amazing, food was great, music was good, drinks were fantastic.  This time was the worst and I will never go back.  What in the world happened to this place!? It has turned classless. Drinks were served in plastic acrylic cups with cracks on the bottom. My rosé tasted like a 4 dollar bottle of wine. My boyfriends whiskey was watered down completely. Plus they don't have food anymore?? The outdoor area wasn't even open although it was 80 degrees out. Not sure what the music was but it was bad. Toilet paper all over the bathroom floors.  I could go on. I'm just disappointed in what this once classy place has turned into.  Good thing there are plenty more rooftops in the city!!

Walking Chicago looking for a cool roof deck to grab a drink on stumbled across CERISE in the virgin hotel....after the elevator ride up was greeted by the security,very friendly....the. Bar/lounge had a hip feel to it great mix of people all ages and races... Seemed a casual dress code....the drinks I got where fantastic... the views of city added to the cool feel would defiantly Come back a spot worth checking out for sure
Cerise (French for cherry) truly is the cherry on top. I'd like to thank Deverick (sorry if I mis-spelled) and the entire staff. I will be back early and often. Thanks again guys!

Love this place! I went there yesterday for the first time with some girlfriends for my birthday, and was blown away with the service. The manager gave us a free round of drinks on him in honor of my birthday and the bar inside gave us complimentary champagne as well. The view is beautiful and the bar itself is really nice! I can't wait to come back :)

Came here after the City Winery event on the Riverwalk on Friday. It was part of the City Winery event and was closed to the public. The rooftop space is small and kinda narrow compared to other rooftop bars, which can be a hassle if trying to walk around, pass people. This kinda let you know how rooftop bar/lounges are the future and every hotel want a piece of the pie, even if they do not fully have the space - they will make space! The view is nice tho, especially at night. They also had a DJ who I must admit played nice old school 90's jams, which is always appreciated, and make you feel like you're truly partying with the grown and sexy. Cerise from the feel and look appear that on your average weekend probably cater to the younger - early to late 20's crowd. Someone also made mention they charge on weekends after like 10pm. Not sure if this is true, but if it is this make me question if you want to be categorized as a party or a rooftop lounge bar. I received complimentary wine as part of the City Winery event and it was basic white wine, nothing special to say about it. I also ordered their signature red Sangria, which was really good. I do like the fact they have the heating lamps in case of it being a cool night. Their menu is very limited and the selections are few and not very appealing. When you think of bar food and a rooftop that stays open kinda late, you think of basic options, like party chicken wings, truffle fries, pop corn shrimp, quesadillas, mini sliders, etc. They did allow me to go down a couple floors to another bar and order the party wings and bring them back up, which was weird and a tad bit of an unnecessary hassle because the elevator would not let me back up to the roof-top and I had to go down on the main floor and have a security guard let me up. Talk about a "controlled environment."  I am sure you all share the same kitchen, why not just have them on the rooftop menu? The bartenders were hit or miss with some being friendly and some coming across irritated, which really makes me wonder why are you even in this business at all?!? No one is forcing you to work as a bartender, so if you don't like it, just quit and save the customers the unpleasant experience. All in all this rooftop probably will fall in the last choice to come to option when considering rooftops when there are so many others.

Been here a couple times mostly for day drinking with buddies. The view is amazing!!!  Have never been here at night, but I'm sure it would look just as great as it does during the day. The place looks pretty cool, a little narrow could be a bit "spacier" as others have said. Had many of the cocktails on the menu, nothing really good or special. Service is okay. Last time I was here only one bar was open at the other side of the place which was annoying. Don't know if this is more of a "party" rooftop, but it a great place to relax and chill and enjoy the views.

Amazing rooftop bar. It had spectacular views of the whole city!! Also one of the managers heard we were celebrating a birthday and brought out shots to our group. All the waitstaff was friendly and welcoming. This bar was beautiful. Signature cocktails were also on point!! They had so many delightful under notes of flavor. I also lovedt the somewhat African decor the bar had. It gave it a very fun eclectic feel. I would without a doubt recommend this bar to anyone looking for a fun place.

Went to this bar after a nice dinner at the Signature Room. I was a little disappointed with the seating. There are several high back bench seating with large throw pillows. It was a little hard to sit like a lady with a skirt and heels. These seats give you privacy from behind but it faces another seat, so you'll be facing another couple. The high backs don't allow for the best views on the deck.  The signature drinks are creative. I had a Colada Frada. It was tasty without being too sweet. My husband had a Sailor Jerry and Diet Coke.  He really doesn't think it was Sailor but more like Bacardi Gold. The bar tender did poor him a new one in front of him but it still didn't quite taste right.  I was sad that the outdoor patio closed at 11pm and we had to come inside. Bummer! I mean that's why we chose this place. We hung out only for about 15 minutes inside.  The music was not our taste or what to us would be popular.

This place is so cool! The decoration is awesome with a hippie style. Music is loud but it is good music - 80's. The view is breathtaking! One of the best rooftop views I have seen in the city. The only thing that didn't collaborate was the weather. I wish I could be here in a sunny day to enjoy even more the outside area.
great view. reasonably priced beer. that's all i need.

This is a rooftop bar on top of the Virgin Hotel in Chicago. I has really nice view of the nearby skyline including the Trump Tower. Looks really nice at night. Trendy looking place but I've been at better rooftop establishments in Chicago.  Visited May 2016

My scale: 5 Stars: I recommend this without any exceptions. I will come back (more than once) and bring friends! 4 Stars: I recommend this under certain circumstances. Worth going, but ONE thing was off. 3 Stars: I was ok, but in a city like Chicago you can find better places. I wouldn't come back. 2 Stars: Disappointed. I wouldn't come back, even if it was the last place in Chicago. 1 Star: Don't go here! Rip-off, Tourist-trap, dangerous, or something like this. Please close this place.  I like it and usually bring friends here too.  Unlike other rooftops, this one is pretty modern and young. They usually even have a DJ and the music is playing louder. But this totally depends on when you go there. I have had relaxing afternoons there as well. It would say, that it is comparable to the Wit. However, Cerise has a nicer and bigger outside space.  But here comes the real reason why I come back: They have on of the best Gimlets in the City! Their house gimlet, tastes great since they are making their own lime juice.  Unfortunately, the last time I went it tasted different. Lets just hope the bartender was sick.... oh wait, lets not hope that. Lets hope the Gimlet will taste as good as it used to last fall again.

This wasn't a bad place. Just didn't like that there wasn't any food on the rooftop. Also that only a portion of the roof was open because rain was in the forecast (it never did rain). Don't Like drinking over priced drinks and not being a little tipsy. Just saying.
Took my boyfriend here for his birthday just to enjoy the view. This place has a great view of the city, but I wish the rooftop was a bit spacier though!

Cerise has one of the best views of the city toward the Loop and River North but not much of the Lake. It's interesting to see the modern decor of the place contrasting with the beaux-arts and Chicago School architecture around as well as other modern buildings. Great view and ambiance. When I went with a cousin for drinks in June 2015, the apps menu there didn't really appeal to us, so we went to their first-level restaurant to eat and returned after. The bartender was nice and a security guy who took a few pictures of my cousin and I, but a server was very rude to us--ugly stare and pushed my cousin as she turned a corner without an apology. If we were the few people up there who made it out on a cold day, we expected better treatment. Not going to let one bad apple ruin the experience for us because the other employees were very friendly, quick, and approachable. I will return again for happy hours with friends, and I hope to have a better experience.

This spot is a hidden gem! When talking about rooftop bars, clubs and lounges in Chicago, nobody talks about Cerise and I have no idea why. Amazing views, great service and yummy cocktails. I'm so glad we came here while out in Chicago. Our waitress was the SWEETEST! Tipped her extra because she really took care of us and made sure us Californians never had an empty glass. The outside lounge area is super cute and open. I much prefer this spot over Trump or Sky Lounge.  Come here if you're out for cocktails in the windy city, you won't regret it!

Came here for happy hour on a weeknight for the first time and must say I felt quite underdressed! This place is NICE but not snotty, bartenders were attentive and made my drink strong. The view from the rooftop is pretty amazing, as is the decor.

TL;DR: GO TO THIS PLACE NOW. I was visiting family who lives about a block away, and they have a 3 month old baby, so I had to find someplace I can go on my own and still have fun. I was nervous that I was in a city I was unfamiliar with, and that I was going to be a loner the entire night, lol. But not at all, thanks to this place!  - Amazing drinks. Their homemade honey whiskey is phenomenal, and it definitely gets the job done. I had about 4 of those (plus some other drinks) and I had a reallllly good night.  I also met the gentleman (I'm so upset I forgot his name- He was super handsome and kind) who came up with the recipe for the honey whiskey, and he was just fantastic. He even made me another recipe of his which was very herb-y, and tasted like sage. I didn't even know I liked sage until I had this drink. Super delicious. - Beautiful venue with strange, but fun decoration. I was standing at the bar and wanted a chair, and one of the bartenders somehow snuck a chair out for me.  - Speaking of bartenders. OMG. How are these people so beautiful and angelic and just perfect human beings? They knew I was alone at the bar and visiting from LA, and they were just extra attentive and charming and friendly. TOMMY, GENO, and one other tall, bearded bartender whose name slips me :'( you guys are superstars and totally made my first night in Chicago. I hope you all get raises!!!!
I don't care that the cocktails are pricey, it's Chicago, the view is worth every cent. I loved it!!! Would definitely return. If you're visiting, I would stop by. Can't wait for summer to return.

Hey I wrote a very negative review earlier when I was rudely turned away from Cerise one night. Just spoke with Linh there and he was beyond solicitous. Will definitely be going back to try Cerise again.
I went around 10:30 pm on a wednesday.  It was very peaceful and beautiful on the 26th floor.  I am sure it gets really packed on busier nights.  I would love to come back-  the views are amazing!

Monday, October 19, 2015. It was raining so the outside area was closed. It smelled stale on the inside. The crowd was just there. Nothing interesting. I had some time to kill before meeting friends for dinner at Bijan and had one drink at the bar. The male bartender finally comes over (it wasn't that busy) forces not even half of a smile and doesn't speak one word. I'm like, hello, he says hi and looked uncomfortable and irritated. I order my drink. While I'm standing at the bar, I notice a few different people come up and wait for a bartender, they didn't come, and the people moved around to get service. Mind you, not busy and not a large bar area whatsoever. There were 2 bartenders back there. I go to the communal restroom before I leave. I am drying my hands in the dryer and a guy walks in and almost went in the women's bathroom. The women's is labeled Birds and the men's is Blokes. A little silly if you ask me. He asks is this the right one and I said no, men's is right here which is where the hand dryers are situated. He asked why I was over there and I said obviously, drying my hands. He said, I don't like you over there. What an idiot. The moral of the story is, I am all for unique settings but a communal restroom area is a horrible idea where there are intoxicated people. It could be dangerous considering you have to go down a flight of stairs to get there that look like the back stairway of a high rise building, alcohol alters idiots minds more quickly than respectable people's going for a cocktail or two and, I'm sure there is no shortage of inappropriate and ignorant comments in the communal area where the sinks and hand dryers are located. I have been there twice before and it was ok but first and last time going into that restroom. I wish I could remember the male bartenders names (2of them) on opening night, some of the nicest bartenders ever.

Until today, all my experiences at the Virgin Hotel have been pretty good since the hotel opened. I've eaten at Miss Rickey's several times for breakfast and have had coffee and wine downstairs. My friend and I were out and about and thought a drink on the rooftop would be the perfect way to spend the afternoon.  The drinks were fine, although nothing special, but the service was horrendous. I was told by a manager after I complained that a server called out and they were short staffed but honestly that's no excuse to treat patrons poorly.  The server Autumn cashed out our first round of drinks and didn't even ask if we wanted to start a tab. We were finished our drinks for at least 20 minutes and still were not asked if we want another one. We tried to flag down her a few times without luck. Even after we went to the bar and asked for another round, the service was still really slow. She also never apologized.  I expect better service at a downtown hotspot and with spending $75 plus for four cocktails. The plus is the space is great and comfortable...

Super trendy bar with a great outdoor roof deck. The bar area and outdoor space is best, the dj and lounge areas are a bit awkward but that could be due to the fact that it's never really being utilized. Craft cocktails list is well done, I love that you can turn some of them into pitchers if you have a large group. I'm still not sure if this has managed to escape the cheesy hotel bar category, but it's worth checking out.

We were 6 well dressed people who went there around 1am. They made us wait for 25 minutes outside in the line, then they sent us to second floor to wait before we could go to the roof. We waited on the second floor for 1h before we went to the hostess asking whether they would let us up. When they actually let us up it was very few people there. I regret going there; I could have spent my one night in Chicago much better.

Unfortunately we arrived after midnight, and the outdoor veranda was closed. Of the things we saw from the inside looking out, it was breathtaking. I can definitely see the appeal of that.  The decor is unique and interesting; the crowd mirrors this. Music was great! There was a live dj there when we arrived.  Although it was nice, it's not a place I would come back to again. Drinks are stiff, but the price is too! It came out to about $50 for two crown and Coke doubles.  Note: you should dress nice! People who were wearing flannels and jeans (dudes) who were interested in going to the lounge were turned away for not looking snazzy enough.

I was truly glad to have come to this beautiful establishment! It has a lay back Ambiance with a great DJ. The View is simply gorgeous, you have a direct View to the Trump Hotel, the Michigan Lake and other outstanding building in the city! I had an "Old Fashion"  they have a particular way of making it and it tasted great so I recommend you order it! Definitely a spot to be at.

This rooftop bar is on the 26th floor of the swanky Virgin Hotel. The views are amazing, especially at dark, you can see the Willis Tower, the Chicago River, and the Trump Tower. The decor is really nice and there is plenty of seating. Drink menu was creative and delicious.

Katie & Zack - thank you! As you took great care of us, fantastic cocktails (refreshing libations), amazing service, and the forces of a beautiful day/view combined w/ a kool eclectic setting topped off the amazing experience.   Sir Richard, well done! We'll be back!

I came here for an afternoon event with a few featured drinks that were free, so I can't comment on how this place is on a regular night.  The location is great, and the view is nice on the rooftop.  I also found that this bar had a lot of seating options both indoors and outside, which is always refreshing.  The bar area is cute, but seems a bit small and understaffed for the location.  The DJ was fine, but it was an afternoon party, so I don't think the party was going to get hopping.  The bad part about the party, which may have been a result of the organizers or may have been due to the venue.  The event was sold as a brunch sampling but had almost no food, in fat I did not get a single bite of anything and went out to brunch with a friend afterwards.  In addition to no food, the free drinks they poured were literally enough for a sip and a half.  It was not a good look.  In addition, I was there on an extremely hot summer day and they did not have water available for people sitting outside, so we had to go in and clog up the bar even more trying to order water.  Overall, a great location, but they have some kinks to work out.  I'd like to visit again on an evening to check out the scene, food and drinks.

My girlfriend and I stopped by here for a drink. First we came through the front door and security told us to take a flight of stairs down and then make a right. There another security guy had us walk down a short hallway to a set of elevator doors and then a security guard on the elevator took us right up to the roof top where we meet up with who? another security guard who welcomed us. LOLSo for a first impression I had to laugh. I had never gone down to go up and passed through so much security in my life at any hotel LOL. However upon arriving at the roof top I must say the set up was nice. Outdoor seating with nice cushion seats of purple. Spaced perfectly with views of the night time Chicago skyline that was magnificent. Just to get the view...the travel up to the floor was worth it. We settled at a table by the bar. A DJ was playing a mix of music (pretty loudly but I am getting old). The bar tenders where outstanding. They even made up a concoction for my girlfriend since they didn't have Godiva chocolate for the original drink she wanted. She was very happy. So much so that I ended up ordering the same drink. Their plates are small, very small, but I must be honest the menu said "small plates" and so did our waitress. So I should not have been shocked. I ordered the Japanese chicken wings and frankly there where only 3 but woowee they were good. Atmosphere and views get a pure 10, seating arrangement on deck - 10, food selection was limited which drops them to 3 star. Drinks were great. The service was wonderful. The bartenders were excellent. Would I return - sure. But not right away. Basically I can say... been there, done that. But I do see myself returning next summer to share that view with friends.

Is it me or are all the rooftop bars starting to blend together? Allow me be more clear,,,the attitude from bartenders that since they work at a rooftop drinking establishment they can be snooty and rude and act inconvenienced when you ask for a drink? Enter Cerise. We came after work on Friday a few months ago (I'm a little behind on my reviews). Twas a little busy. Finally we made it to the front of the bar and the bartender just sighs and looks at me - no smile or greeting. Yes I notice these things. But since I had alcohol on the brain, I quickly ordered some drinks and moved along.  We sat outside and enjoyed the early summer weather with partly cloudy views of the city - quite nice. The decor and furnishings seem to be a cross between A Clockwork Orange and Austin Powers. Chic English like Richard Branson. If you are looking to meet people, I wouldn't recommend Cerise. I observed that though there were many groups of friends, they all seemed to be on their phones instead of socializing with each other. I feel so old.

New Richard Branson hotel and new uber trendy rooftop bar that opened this summer. Small and quite a scene. Highlights: - Shrimp dumplings: wasn't planning on having a snack but these were divine.  - Cocktails: appreciated that the menu got creative as a departure from all the run of the mill stuff. I enjoyed the ones I got. - Rooftop: views of close buildings like trump  - Seating: some small tables inside the long room and some outside (couches and tables) around 2 walls - Clientele: definitely those who want to be seen at a place to be. An entertaining scene  Lowlights:  - Weird route to the bathroom: down the stairs amidst black walls and bit hard to determine which door to go into  - Gets crowded: we were there right when it opened that day and within minutes space was filling up. I can only imagine what it's like during nighttime party hours. Cool small rooftop bar if you can sneak in before the masses.

Gorgeous rooftop! Loved the ambiance. Great views at a great happy hour spot in the loop. Less busy than Cindy's (which, yes, has a better view of the lake/Millennium Park) with more outdoor seating. Lots of little loungey areas and an open communal table. Drinks were good and decently priced. Staff was friendly and unpretentious. We went on a Thursday at happy hour so I can't speak for the busyness/atmosphere at other times, but we really enjoyed ourselves.

This bar has a great view of the city, but it is a very odd layout and service was slow.  I visited on a week night and it took awhile for our waitress to come over and bring our drink.  It did look like there was a larger party that may have been keeping her busy and delaying service for other customers.  Also, this is a hotel bar so drinks are a little pricey for the area, but you are clearly paying for the view.  I would only head back if I have guests visiting the city and want to show them a cool view of the city.

This new rooftop bar is simply on of the best in Chicago. The staff is super nice, the music is just perfect and the drinks are some of the best I have ever had in Chicago. The music is usually a great blend of house and dance beats. They bring in djs from all over the country and from right here in Chicago.  Piers is one of the bartenders there and is one of the most talented mixologists I have ever met. He just has talent running though his blood. It is a complete treat to walk in and have him surprise me and my friends with the most amazing spirit concoctions I have ever had. That said, the rooftop is an amazing place, but Piers is simply "the icing on the cake". Pro tip: Ask for him.  If you love a good drink and great music, head to cerise immediately.

Had some of the best drinks ever from Piers! He made two drinks that I'll try to remake the rest of my life and fail at miserably. All I had to say was the flavor a I had in mind and the rest was history. Definitely going back and being surprised at the delights Piers will concoct!

Ambience wise, this place nails it. It's all sorts of pretty including the staff. For a Chicago rooftop bar, the outdoor part is pretty small. Think narrow wraparound porch. I might come back if we secured an outside table but wouldn't come back otherwise. I like pretty but I also like my bars to be on point with the sips. I ordered a Belvedere tonic and got something that tasted like well vodka soda. I took pity on the newbie bartender though and channeled my 20-something self to empty that glass. When it came to drink 2, I decided on something from the cocktail list. It took forever and a day to flag someone down and another day to actually get my drink. Thankfully, the dj was pretty good so I at least had decent music to enjoy.

Found this place from a review online. I'll start by saying the place is definitely happening. Cozy, hipster, rooftop speakeasy-ish spot. Fantastic views of the city from the wrap around porch. Great music from the DJ. Good drinks and food. A must for a casual evening.

I arrived around 5:30PM for happy hour with friends. Thankfully two of them arrived earlier and were able to snag a table for us. The location itself is very nice with a great view of the river/Trump Tower. I liked the rotating pitcher special.I can't comment on any of the other drinks. The food is expensive. You couldn't really hear any music while you're on the patio which is nice because you can have a decent conversation. There is a variety of seating. I was not a fan of the stone table with the stone lamps. But at least they have complimentary flavored water stations.  It wasn't difficult to get up, but be aware that they do enforce a dress code at 8PM.

Came here for drinks with some coworkers and was really unimpressed.  It's new, so I guess I wasn't surprised how crowded it was, but the set up is very strange, not really geared towards the 5pm crowd.  There are loveseats set up everywhere, which would lend itself to a cozy date, but not so much large groups trying to soak in some rooftop rays. The bar is very scene-y, and relies on the "coolness" factor rather than solid drinks and service.  It took about 15 minutes of waiting expectantly, plus a 5 minute walk around the bar searching for service before we actually got some.  The cocktails were fine, but didn't blow us away.  We had a carafe of the gin/prosecco cocktail and it was very light and refreshing.  It's not somewhere I would come for a proper cocktail though. I think if you're looking for something trendy, a cool date spot, this could be your place.  Otherwise, I'd skip it.  Chicago has so many great rooftops with amazing service, I've definitely experienced better.

Came to Cerise around 8:30 on a Friday night. My gf and I lucked out because we got there just before they started wait-listing people to go up to the top. Cerise has more of a club feel to it, especially the music and furniture. Bartenders weren't super friendly but the staff/security was better than what I expected going in. Unfortunately, and this is part of why I have to give 3 stars, a rainstorm was coming and they were shutting down the outside section/patio shortly after we got up top. This place definitely isn't worth it if the outside isn't open. I have a feeling they weren't telling people that on the ground floor either, given how many people I saw that were sent to the second floor bar while I was waiting on my gf in the bathroom. I don't mind paying a little extra for drinks at a bar like this, or having to wait in line to get up top, but this place just wasn't my scene. I liked Cindy's a lot better over at the Chicago Athletic Association Hotel, which is a little calmer and has a MUCH better view.

I have mixed feelings about the night, but when I look back, I take away a mostly positive experience. I RSVP'ed for the pitchfork after party & knew that space was still limited, even with the RSVP. I knew the event started at 10, but wanted to double check with virgin what time the DJ set started while I couldn't reach my friends during the day. The woman at the front desk kind of yelled at me over the phone--"it's not a DJ, it's a BAND!" Ok...I know it's a band, but they will be DJing the party, they're not playing their own show hah.  When I arrived, I was stopped by 2 hotel staff telling me it was at capacity but I was able to go hang out with my friends in the little green room area. This is where we met a young woman...I wish I remembered her name, cute bubbly blonde, who was taking care of us the whole night. She was seriously amazing! So nice & so hospitable. I took a photo with her so maybe someone at cerise can identify her...and give her a raise haha. We ended up going into the set and it was MORE than at capacity. There was a point where traffic stopped in front of the DJ booth. I couldn't see the tops of their heads even, so I decided to go enjoy the music somewhere away from the clump of people and get myself a drink. The gal I mentioned earlier saw me sitting outside of the DJ area and asked if I wanted to be inside near my friends. I did & she got me in there! Seriously, so amazing. Around 12:40 the fire marshal shut the set down, and rightly so because probably 1/2 the amount of people in there should have been. I'm not sure how that could have been avoided--fewer rsvp slots available? Maybe making the capacity lower when there are high profile DJs & you can assume guests will all be huddled around them? It just seemed like the venue wasn't prepared to handle that size of a crowd. But as far as drinks go--I've read a review that they served weak drinks? My drinks were strong, just the way I like them! After we left the rooftop and headed back to the hospitality area, we were still being catered to. I had contacted cerise here on yelp actually before I came about bringing a gift and they were very friendly and accommodating and double checked with security, which was nice of them to do. The first and last impressions I had were kind of weird, but everything in between was awesome! The "too long; didn't read" version-- Pros: hospitality, drink quality, music, beautiful setting Cons: crowd control
The view from the rooftop was awesome and the staff was attentive and nice. We were there for a Moet sponsored event so there were many extras. The drinks and food we ordered were great.

I have now been to Cerise twice and I can definitively say that this place is SO NOT worth the money or the wait, You are better off going to basically any other rooftop/bar in Chicago. The first time I went we arrived right after work with a group (around 5pm) the service was fine but the drinks were weak as can be. We finally started ordering beers because at least we could count on those having alcohol in them.  The second time I went was last Saturday with friends. First I called the front desk around 7:30 and asked if she expected there would be a line. She said no because the weather had not been very good. She was totally wrong, we stood in line for close to an hour. By the way we were told right after we got in that we were the last ones and that now they were at capacity. So not really sure what we were waiting in line for for an hour if the bar was not full. We finally get up to the bar after being outfitted with cheap paper wristbands that we had to show to the guard to get into the elevator. We were a group of four and wanted to eat and drink. I was excited for the asian fusion type food, but was sorely disappointed.  The salmon sashimi was good (even though it was only a thick cut of salmon wrapped around a stick of cucumber (for three pieces at $13 i expected more). The Ahi Tuna was borderline inedible it was so covered with salt - I wouldnt have been suprised if it wasnt tuna at all. The japanese "chicken wings" were also way to salty.  For the drinks we ordered a pitcher of the Sakura Fizz which was extremely watered down and tasted like you were drinking straight tonic water. After that debacle I started ordered my own drinks thinking maybe pitchers were the wrong choice. I ordered a cosmo, which again had little to no liquor in it. Finally my friends and I went for Martinis because, we thought, at least that would be more bang for our buck. BY FAR the worst martini I have ever had. It again tasted like water and I actually was served a martini that was 25% crushed ice......Sorry but next time ill stay in and make myself a martini that doesn't cost $13. I have never even heard of ice in a martini. Overall this place is TOTALLY not worth it. Seriously go anywhere else. As a side note the decor is cheap and looks like you are in an Austin Powers movie (not in a good way) and all of the menus were stuck to the bar which was covered in spilled drinks. The people themselves were dressed up to the nines but just a strange crowd. I think the only reason I even gave this place one star was for the views, but problem is, once you hike out to the loop on a Saturday night - there is really no other bars around you.

Great view, but very disappointing drinks.  The one I wanted was 86'd, which is not something I anticipated with the reputation of Virgin's businesses.  Go early to grab the seat you want, which can be somewhat intimate or for a large group.  Would have preferred not to listen to a DJ at 2pm.

Not sure what all the hype is about. This place has become one of my least favorite rooftop bars in the city. The overall feeling seemed like more of a nightclub that is only open after-hours and the drinks were meh.
as far as rooftop bars go, it was a pretty good deal, had one $11 beer cocktail, and it wasnt crowded and the view was really nice, granted it was 2pm on a saturday, but id be willing to go again

I go out. A lot. This place really needs to get its act together in order to survive in Chicago. It's like no one here wants to help anyone let alone go out of their way to service the guest.  Dropped some dough on three drinks and cut out. Quickly.  Dear Mr. Branson... Fire someone or at the very least, have them flogged and re-trained in the Virgin way.  Thanks.  8/4/15 The day after I reviewed Cerise, I received a notification on Yelp from Virgin with an email address for the F&B director. I sent an email to her... that was two weeks ago.  I would assume the lack of reply is because she is (1) receiving so many of these terrible reviews that it is taking her time to reply to them; or (2) there are so many terrible reviews that she is no longer at her post.  Regardless, I'll never be back. There are too many other options in this great city.

What a HUGE let down, and after thinking about this all weekend, and most of the week,  I am down right LIVID with Cerise and the staff.  I took my cousin here to kick off her Bday celebration. I arrived our before our very small party of 3 I was making my way inside when one of the doormen yelled at me (wth?!). He said if I was going to Cerise I have to stand in line on the OTHER side of the building (Ok. thanks for yelling at me sir. Maybe my forehead said 'going to Cerise?') Anyways, stood in line for 30 min outside, to then go inside give your name to the chick with the iPad, she tells you to either hang out at the coffee bar, or go upstairs to wait at the other bar, and that it would only be 20-25min wait. We waited over an hour, we then get the text to go back downstairs, get our hand stamped, and then proceed to go another floor down, to an elevator to be taken upstairs. We arrived upstairs, and I literally had to hunt someone down for some service. This really would have been a non-issue had the place been 'at capacity' like the hostess downstairs stated, but I have been to places much busier and have gotten faster service. FINALLY, I get the attention of a server, I wanted to make my cousin's Bday really special, so we got bottle service. One of the bouncer's was nice enough to point out that there was an available table for us to sit at and enjoy our bottle of Champagne, the table was sticky, and dirty. It was eventually cleaned with a wet dish rag (on a glass table, you don't clean glass with a wet rag, but what do I know).  Half way through our evening our server came to us and introduced Shannon? (really nice red-head) and said she was going on break and that Shannon would take over for her. We ended up with Shannon the rest of the night, and she was great, very attentive she helped us out in getting a candle for my cousin's cupcakes (not really sure what happened to our original server). At the end of the night our original server re-appears to see if we needed anything (not really sure where she ran off to). At this point I just wanted to close out my tab, so she ran my card a total of 8 times (per my fraud prevention Rep) 8 times?! this of course set off all sorts of fraud alerts, locking my funds (was the server drinking on the job?) not really sure what the heck happened, but the whole experience was horrible, I spent almost $400 in this place to be treated like I was going to skip out on my tab.  They tried to make us feel better by giving us a round of "free" shots, that they ended up spilling all over my friend's feet.  Also I'm STILL waiting for the manager to contact me regarding this fiasco.

Myself and a group of friends met for happy hour at Cerise on July 20th and had a great time! The staff was friendly and the atmosphere was great. The bathrooms had a unisex entrance and unisex hand washing area which was a little odd... We sat both inside and outside-both were great.  They had a DJ going that night, DIOS RIOS, who was awesome! I can't think of the last time I saw a DJ who spun mostly all vinyl- so major props to him! The change in pace from what you hear playing at a River North or Lincoln Park bar was very refreshing. I'll definitely head back to Cerise for happy hour and I hope to hear DIOS RIOS spinning when i'm there!

Went here on a Saturday night with a group of friends, fantastic music, fun people, and even a space to dance. The rooftop is way more laid back then a lot of places in Chicago and has outdoor beds where you can lay on. An awesome place to hang with friends and bring people visiting in town!!
Me and my wife went for a drink and we ended up staying the whole night! Music was unique and service was on point!
Really good music, very nice staff. Will come back

Do NOT try to have an event here! The management has different policies depending on who you speak to. First it is "first come, first serve," then it is "$100 per person," then there are "only reservations on certain days." What a mess. They are money-hungry and not accommodating in the least. The bartenders are very nice, however the waitresses are rude, clumsy, and forgetful. Nice view, but this place will not last with management and staff like this. Not worth it. Go somewhere else.

This review is for one of their "after parties". We had RSVP'ed online, waited in line for about an hour or so, then when we got in they said we'd be put on a list to be let up to the rooftop about 2 hours later. They welcomed us into their lobby bar while we waited, which ended up being a sneaky trap for those that spent money on food and drinks only to be never let in. And no, they did not say you "might" be let in - there was even a countdown clock you could check to see how much longer you had to wait. But when time was up... I guess you just had to sneak up through the stairwell! Seems this new hotel hasn't worked out its kinks OR its loopholes yet. It's really too bad that whoever they have planning and managing their events clearly has no idea what they're doing.

I think timing played a huge role, arrived at 4:15 on a Wednesday.  Excellent service and seats at the bar. By 5:00 the place was a mob scene of future capitalist moguls and "check out how cool I am now that I'm divorced but, clearly I'm too old for this crowd" men & women. Great cocktails, the Bunny sparkling Sake is pretty great. Plan to go early to stake out a spot on a great city evening, it's worth it.

My bestie and I are on a mission to check out all of the new rooftop bars before we're forced to hibernate for solid 6 months. Naturally that led us to Cerise.  After waiting outside in line for maybe 15 minutes, we were let inside only to wait in a second line.  At this point I'm confused, what's with the lines?  I feel like I'm at Disney world, this bar better be as exciting as Splash Mountain or I'm going to be pissed. Finally a cute young girl greets us with an ipad, states it's a 30 minute wait to get upstairs,  she will take our number and text us when it's our turn.  In meantime we can walk upstairs to get drinks at 2nd floor hotel bar.   Fast forward 1.5 hours.  We finally get text after sitting at the pretty standard hotel bar that it's our time, we're in! We go back down to hostess who gives us tacky bright red lip stamps and instructs us to go downstairs to elevator which will then take us upstairs....after getting lost in what I think was the mens bathroom we finally find elevators and ride up.  As soon as the doors open we know we've made an epic mistake.  I'm blinded by faux fur chairs, dad jeans, and scrunchie hair ties.  The rooftop looked nice, but I wouldn't know since the outdoor portion was closed and I'm stuck gazing longingly out the windows like a prisoner.  Didn't bother to even stay for one cocktail.  Summer is too short to waste on a place like this. Now I'm stuck with this bright red stamp on my hand like a scarlet letter. No matter how much scrubbing I do everyone knows where I've been, and I'm ashamed.
It's sticky. It really needs to be cleaned. The employees wear some sort of airline stewardess outfits. It's just a really clumsy set up with couches that are in the way but to large to utilized.
Such a great chill atmosphere. Loved the view. Drinks are pricey but so worth it. Crab cakes were also bomb attire is a couple steps up from casual
Great views, great drinks, great staff. The views at this rooftop are absolutely amazing. Staff is friendly and kind. The overall vibe of this place is awesome. Definitely will come back soon.
Fantastic experience and service. Trendy new spot with great drinks. Try the Iaca on a summer day, delish!
I have seen better. The views are great, but the drinks were over-priced, there were stains from spilled drinks on some of the furniture, and the waitstaff is pretentious. I won't go back.

On the 26th floor of the new Virgin Hotel at Wabash and Lake is Cerise, the new rooftop lounge/bar. I was immediately impressed by the decor - chic and elegant. A lot of conversation pieces. A large variety of seating options from communal tables - sofas - outdoor - individual chairs. Large outdoor wrap around deck with western views. You have the option of ordering directly from the bar or cocktail service.  I saw a ton of board games near the indoor communal table and interesting books. At 5pm on a Friday this place was busy. Live DJ and folks from all walks of life. Drink prices were average for Loop. Perhaps I was having a "senior moment" but I thought the music on the 26th floor was a tad too loud. I was practically yelling at my friend and found it difficult to follow our conversation. Luckily they have a bar/lounge on the 1st or 2nd floor and it was toned way down and I could have a proper conversation with my friend. Our server was extremely friendly and provided some drink recommendations. I'd definitely return and would bring out-of-town guests here for a drink or two.

Cerise is a much welcome addition to the wonderful assortment of Chicago rooftop bars.  Unlike many other rooftops, however, Cerise manages to be sophisticated and refined without an air of pretentiousness.   The decor inside is eccentric and bright, while the patio outside boasts some of the best views in the entire city.  The entire space, both indoors and out, is incredibly inviting and makes for the perfect, casual drinking atmosphere. The staff here are all very friendly and accommodating.  Tommy, our bartender, was helpful in making drink recommendations and guiding us through the space.  The drinks themselves were very well made, with unique flavors.  Pricing was very fair for the location.  They do have small plates, but I have not yet tried them. I definitely recommend checking out this space while you have a chance before the Summer ends.  It really is something else.

Another fun rooftop bar has come to Chicago! I came with a few of my girlfriends on a Saturday afternoon. We stood in line for about 15 minutes. After that, we were given a stamp, proceeded to go up the staircase, to take an elevator up to the rooftop. The person managing the rooftop was confused because we were suppose to have a 'text' but we told we were stamped so we got in.  If you've ever been to the WIT, then I'll tell you- it's pretty similar. As soon as you walk into the tight bar space, you hear loud dance music. The small bar is messy and the bartender made me a bad mojito. I'm picky about  cocktails so I would stick to beer or wine if I was you. Then there is outdoor space with good views.  If you like to party- then go here. But if you're looking to relax, then go elsewhere.  It's fun! But nothing more special than that.

Cerise is a gorgeous rooftop space, part hip London club-part Chicago art nouveau. The kind of place cool kids hangout without it being pretentious. I sat upon the roof drinking a well crafted cocktail served by a warm staff and ate the freshest sashimi while watching a thunderstorm move through Chicago's south side. It was magic.
Weak drinks. Ok wine list. Inattentive bartenders. With all the rooftop options in Chicago this one just isn't worth it.

Had the best time here, after an epic fail at IO Urban Roofscape! This place is by far a better place with great music, food, drinks, atmosphere, and the amazing view!! Will definitely be coming back!!

I went here for a networking event.  Although it was raining out that day the sun made a brief appearance and you can tell how nice this space was. The rooftop almost gives a 360 view. I like that there were multiple areas to sit at weather in chairs or fun bright colored coaches. Part of the rooftop is covered, so it's nice to know you can get away from the rain. We got unlimited mimosa's for an hour and those were quite tasty. The food bites there were also decent, but I'm not sure if what we were served would be on the regular menu or not since it was an event. I definitely plan on going back in the near future.

Great spot, trendy yet casual and relaxed. The staff is super friendly, good selection of cocktails and bubbly, outdoor space is huge compared to most rooftops in the city with decent views of the loop and the trump tower. So far it has become an instant favorite for after work Thursdays or for less crowded early afternoon during weekends.

I think that guy that gave the 2 stars must have been drunk when he wrote his review. The drinks are amazing!! Geno the bartender makes the best cocktails. My server Claudia was very attentive to my table even though the venue was packed, she really made me feel as if I were VIP. Her attitude and personality along with genos expertise at the bar is the reason I'll be back. Love the view and the atmosphere !!
Great view but the drinks suck.  Really bad. Had to send one bad.  Not impressed at all with the drinks.  I had three and not one of them were good. I would come back for the view only

Rooftop bar at new Virgin Hotel has a great view, nice layout, and fun vibe.  I can see how it might become pretty cramped for space, some of the pieces of furniture are quite large for the narrow walk ways.  The drinks are as expected, no surprises (no Charles Joly).  I would go for the outdoor space.
